INTRO

musicscore2

musicscore2 is a python library for generating musicxml data in an intuitive and easy but nevertheless exhaustive way. The generated files can be imported in several music notation programs and be processed further if necessary. The preferred software is Finale which seems at the moment to have the best implementation of musicxml format files and supports the newest version 4.0.

musicscore2 consists of two main packages: musicxml and musictree:

musicxml

The central class of this package is the XMLElement class which is the parent of each individual xml element class (like XMLScore, XMLPart etc.). The xml element classes (mainly created automatically) behave exactly as declared in the musicxml schema file. The type_ of Each XMLElement class is set to XSDComplexType or XSDSimpleType`which correspond to xml schema elements ``complexType` and simpleType. The documentation of this package covers only the information given in the musicxml schema file, including the structure of possible or necessary children and attributes indicated by xsd elements and and cannot replace the more comprehensive documentation of W3C Community Group . The topic of xml and xml schema goes beyond the scope of this documentation. For further information see here

musictree

The goal of this package is to simplify the use of musicxml elements. The tree structure of a score plays here a fundamental role and is being controlled via MusicTree parent class. Most of the objects in this hierarchy are closely connected to the corresponding objects in musicxml package and are descendents of XMLWrapper class with an xml_object attribute. There are though some other important classes like Beat or Chord which don’t have any direct equivalents in the musicxml structure.

A musictree consists of a root Score and its 9 descending layers:

  1. musictree.score.Score is the root of a musictree.

    • It is the parent of musictree.part.Part

    • It creates all necessary defaults:

      • Default layout objects inside the default can be changed directly via following properties:

        • scaling musictree.layout.Scaling

        • page_layout musictree.layout.PageLayout

        • system_layout musictree.layout.StaffLayout

        • staff_layout’ musictree.layout.StaffLayout

    • export_xml method can be used to create the “end product” as a xml file.

  2. musictree.part.Part is the first layer of a musictree.

    • It is the parent of musictree.measure.Measure

    • It must have a unique id during initialization. If no name is associated with the part its id will be used as its name.

    • Its method add_measure() can be used to conveniently add measures. It accepts two arguments:

      • number can be used to set the measure number. If None measure’s number will be added automatically as one number higher than the previous measure (or 1 for the first measure).

      • time can be used to set the time signature. If None the previous time signature is adopted and set to hidden. The time signature of the first measure with time None is set to 4/4.

  3. musictree.measure.Measure is the second layer of a musictree.

    • It is the parent of musictree.staff.Staff

    • It must set its number by initialization.

    • It has three important properties which can be set to control measure’s time signature, the clefs of its staves and its key.

      • musictree.time.Time

      • musictree.clef.Clef

      • musictree.key.Key

  4. musictree.staff.Staff is the third layer of a musictree.

    • It is the parent of musictree.voice.Voice

    • It has two properties: number and musictree.clef.Clef

  5. musictree.voice.Voice is the fourth layer of a musictree.

    • It is the parent of musictree.beat.Beat

    • Each voice has its own independent beats which are created based on measure’s time signature.

    • It has a number as property.

    • When its last beat is filled the is_filled property is true.

    • If a musictree.chord.Chord is added to its beats which has a quarter duration greater than the sum of beats’ quarter durations, the remaining Chord can be accessed via left_over property.

  6. musictree.beat.Beat is the fifth layer of a musictree.

    • It is the parent of musictree.chord.Chord

  7. musictree.chord.Chord is the sixth layer of a musictree.

    • It is the parent of musictree.note.Note

      • musictree.dynamics.Dynamics

  8. musictree.note.Note is the seventh layer of a musictree.

    • It is the parent of musictree.midi.Midi

  9. musictree.midi.Midi is the eighth layer of a musictree.

    • It is the parent of musictree.accidental.Accidental

  10. musictree.accidental.Accidental is the ninth layer of a musictree.

QuarterDuration non-writables and quantizing

  • musictree.quarterduration.QuarterDuration

Layout

  • musictree.layout.Scaling

  • musictree.layout.PageLayout

  • musictree.layout.StaffLayout

  • musictree.layout.StaffLayout

Note

This project is under active development.

Check out the Usage section for further information, including how to install the project.
